text: Shaw's Bridge in 2007 Shaw's Bridge is an historic stone arched bridge across the River Lagan in Belfast. It was constructed in 1707, and closed to vehicular access in 1977 after having been replaced by the A55 road bridge, which runs immediately adjacent to it. ==References== Category:Bridges completed in 1707 Category:Bridges in Northern Ireland Category:Buildings and structures in Belfast Category:1707 establishments in Ireland
title: Shaw's Bridge
